Submodules¶

google.cloud.security.notifier.notifier module¶

Notifier.

Usage:

$ forseti_notifier –db_host <Cloud SQL database hostname/IP>
–db_user <Cloud SQL database user> –db_name <Cloud SQL database name (required)> –config <Notification configuration> –timestamp <Snapshot timestamp to search for violations>
google.cloud.security.notifier.notifier.find_pipelines(pipeline_name)[source]¶

Get the first class in the given sub module

Args:
pipeline_name (str): Name of the pipeline.
Return:
class: The class in the sub module
google.cloud.security.notifier.notifier.main(_)[source]¶

Main function.

Args:
_ (obj): Result of the last expression evaluated in the interpreter.
google.cloud.security.notifier.notifier.process(message)[source]¶

Process messages about what notifications to send.

Args:
message (dict): Message with payload in dict.

The payload will be different depending on the sender of the message.

Example:
{‘status’: ‘foobar_done’,
‘payload’: {}}
google.cloud.security.notifier.notifier.run_cscc_notification(notifier_configs, violations_as_dict)[source]¶

Get the first class in the given sub module

Args:
notifier_configs (dict): Notification configuration. violations_as_dict (tuple): Tuple of violations in dict format.
